tables.content:
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 4 tomatoes 
o 4 cups vegetable broth 
o 1 teaspoon cumin 
o 1 teaspoon coriander 
o 1 teaspoon turmeric 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. 
o Add diced tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander, 
turmeric, and salt. 
o Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. 
o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. 
 
Horta 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 pound dandelion greens 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1/4 cup lemon juice 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. 
o Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. 
o Serve warm or chilled. 
 
Hot and Sour Soup 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 cups chicken broth 
o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 
o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots 
o 1/4 cup tofu 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar 
o 1 tablespoon cornstarch 
o 1 teaspoon chili paste 
o 1 egg 
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions 
 
Instructions: 
o Bring chicken broth to a boil. 
o Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. 
o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the soup, stirring until thickened. 
o Beat egg and slowly pour into the soup, stirring constantly. 
o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

Hummus 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 can chickpeas 
o 1/4 cup tahini 
o 1/4 cup lemon juice 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Drain and rinse chickpeas. 
o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. 
o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. 
o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. 
 
Japchae 
 
Ingredients: 
o 8 ounces sweet potato noodles 
o 1/2 pound beef 
o 1 small onion 
o 1 carrot 
o 1 bell pepper 
o 1 cup spinach 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds 
 
Instructions: 
o Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain. 
o Sauté sliced beef, diced onion, julienned carrot, and bell pepper in sesame oil 
until cooked. 
o Add spinach and cook until wilted. 
o Mix noodles with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame seeds. 
o Combine with cooked beef and vegetables. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Jerk Vegetables 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 cup broccoli 
o 1 cup bell peppers 
o 1 cup zucchini 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 2 tablespoons jerk seasoning

o 1/4 cup olive oil 
 
Instructions: 
o Toss vegetables with minced garlic, jerk seasoning, and olive oil. 
o Roast at 400°F (200°C) until tender. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Johnny Cakes 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups flour 
o 1/4 cup sugar 
o 1 tablespoon baking powder 
o 1/2 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup butter 
o 1/2 cup milk 
o Oil for frying 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. 
o Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 
o Add milk and stir until dough forms. 
o Roll out dough and cut into circles. 
o Fry in hot oil until golden. 
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. 
 
Jollof Rice 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups rice 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 4 tomatoes 
o 1/4 cup tomato paste 
o 1/4 cup vegetable oil 
o 1 teaspoon thyme 
o 1 teaspoon curry powder 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper 
o 4 cups chicken broth 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in vegetable oil until softened. 
o Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook 
for 5 minutes. 
o Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. 
o Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. 
o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender. 
o Serve warm.

Kachumbari 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 tomatoes 
o 1 small onion 
o 1 cucumber 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
o 1/4 cup lemon juice 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. 
o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. 
o Serve chilled. 
 
Käsespätzle (Cheese Noodles) 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups flour 
o 1/2 cup milk 
o 3 eggs 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg 
o 1/4 cup butter 
o 1 cup grated cheese 
o 1 small onion 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. 
o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. 
o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. 
o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. 
o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. 
o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad) 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 potatoes 
o 1 small onion 
o 1/4 cup bacon 
o 1/4 cup vinegar 
o 1/4 cup chicken broth 
o 1 tablespoon mustard 
o 1 teaspoon sugar 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper

Kimchi 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 napa cabbage 
o 1/4 cup sea salt 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce 
o 2 tablespoons gochugaru (Korean chili powder) 
o 4 cloves garlic 
o 1 inch ginger 
o 4 green onions 
 
Instructions: 
o Cut cabbage into quarters and soak in salted water for 2 hours. 
o Rinse and drain cabbage. 
o Mix sugar, fish sauce, gochugaru, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped 
green onions in a bowl. 
o Rub mixture onto cabbage leaves. 
o Pack cabbage into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. 
o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. 
 
Kongnamul Muchim 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 pound soybean sprouts 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds 
 
Instructions: 
o Blanch soybean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain. 
o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a bowl. 
o Toss sprouts with the dressing. 
o Serve chilled. 
 
Labneh 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups yogurt 
o 1/2 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix yogurt with salt. 
o Place yogurt in a cheesecloth-lined strainer over a bowl. 
o Let drain in the refrigerator for 24 hours. 
o Transfer labneh to a serving dish and drizzle with olive oil. 
o Serve with pita bread.

Larb 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1/2 pound ground chicken 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce 
o 2 tablespoons lime juice 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1 tablespoon rice powder 
o 1/4 cup mint 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
o 1-2 Thai chilies 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté ground chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. 
o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and rice powder in a bowl. 
o Toss chicken with the dressing, chopped mint, cilantro, and sliced chilies. 
o Serve with lettuce leaves. 
 
Lo Mein 
 
Ingredients: 
o 8 ounces lo mein noodles 
o 1 cup sliced bell peppers 
o 1 cup snow peas 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 1 tablespoon oyster sauce 
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
 
Instructions: 
o Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions, then drain. 
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. 
o Add bell peppers and snow peas, stir-fry until tender. 
o Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, stir to combine. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Loubia 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups white beans 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 4 tomatoes 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1 teaspoon cumin

o 1 teaspoon paprika 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
 
Instructions: 
o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. 
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. 
o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. 
o Mix beans with tomato sauce and cook for 10 minutes. 
o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. 
 
Macaroni and Cheese 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups elbow macaroni 
o 2 cups milk 
o 2 tablespoons butter 
o 2 tablespoons flour 
o 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper 
 
Instructions: 
o Cook macaroni according to package instructions, then drain. 
o Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux. 
o Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. 
o Add cheese, salt, and pepper, stir until melted. 
o Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Manakish 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast 
o 1 teaspoon sugar 
o 1 cup warm water 
o 3 cups flour 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1/4 cup za'atar 
 
Instructions: 
o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. 
o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. 
o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. 
o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. 
o Spread za'atar mixed with olive oil on top. 
o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden. 
o Serve warm.

Mandazi 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups flour 
o 1/4 cup sugar 
o 1 tablespoon baking powder 
o 1/2 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup coconut milk 
o 1/4 cup water 
o Oil for frying 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. 
o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. 
o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. 
o Fry in hot oil until golden. 
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. 
 
Mandu 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 package dumpling wrappers 
o 1/2 pound ground pork 
o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage 
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1 tablespoon soy sauce 
o 1 teaspoon sesame oil 
o Oil for frying 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame 
o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. 
o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. 
o Serve with dipping sauce. 
 
Mango Sticky Rice 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 cup glutinous rice 
o 1 cup coconut milk 
o 1/4 cup sugar 
o 1/4 teaspoon salt 
o 2 mangoes 
 
Instructions: 
o Rinse rice and soak in water for 1 hour. 
o Steam rice until tender. 
o Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until dissolved.

o Mix coconut milk with cooked rice and let sit for 10 minutes. 
o Serve rice with sliced mangoes. 
 
Mapo Tofu 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 block tofu 
o 1/2 pound ground pork 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1 tablespoon chili bean paste 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 1 tablespoon rice wine 
o 1 teaspoon sugar 
o 1/4 cup chicken broth 
o 1 tablespoon cornstarch 
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions 
 
Instructions: 
o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. 
o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. 
o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. 
o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. 
o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. 
o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. 
 
Mashed Potatoes 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 potatoes 
o 1/2 cup milk 
o 1/4 cup butter 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper 
 
Instructions: 
o Peel and dice potatoes. 
o Boil potatoes until tender, then drain. 
o Mash potatoes with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Minestrone 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 onion 
o 2 carrots 
o 2 celery stalks 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1 zucchini

o 1 can diced tomatoes 
o 4 cups vegetable broth 
o 1 can cannellini beans 
o 1 cup pasta 
o 1/4 cup basil 
o 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. 
o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. 
o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. 
o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. 
o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese. 
 
Miso Soup 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 cups dashi broth 
o 1/4 cup miso paste 
o 1/2 cup tofu 
o 1/4 cup green onions 
o 1/4 cup seaweed 
 
Instructions: 
o Heat dashi broth until warm. 
o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. 
o Add diced tofu and seaweed. 
o Simmer for 5 minutes. 
o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. 
 
Moqueca de Banana 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 bananas 
o 1 small onion 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1 bell pepper 
o 2 tomatoes 
o 1 cup coconut milk 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. 
o Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. 
o Stir in coconut milk, sliced bananas, salt, and pepper. 
o Simmer for 10 minutes. 
o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm.

Msemen 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups flour 
o 1 cup semolina 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1 cup water 
o 1/4 cup butter 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix flour, semolina, and salt in a bowl. 
o Add water and knead until smooth. 
o Divide dough into balls and roll out into thin circles. 
o Brush with melted butter and fold into squares. 
o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Muhammara 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 red bell peppers 
o 1/2 cup walnuts 
o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses 
o 1 teaspoon cumin 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Roast bell peppers until charred, then peel and seed. 
o Blend peppers, walnuts, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, olive oil, pomegranate 
molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. 
o Serve with pita bread. 
 
Mutabal 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 eggplants 
o 1/4 cup tahini 
o 1/4 cup lemon juice 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash.

o Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food 
processor. 
o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. 
o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. 
 
Naan 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast 
o 1 teaspoon sugar 
o 1/2 cup warm water 
o 2 1/2 cups flour 
o 1/2 cup yogurt 
o 1/4 cup melted butter 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. 
o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture, yogurt, and melted butter. 
o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. 
o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. 
o Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side. 
o Brush with melted butter and serve warm. 
 
Nom Du Du (Green Papaya Salad) 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 green papaya 
o 2 carrots 
o 1/4 cup peanuts 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce 
o 2 tablespoons lime juice 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1-2 Thai chilies 
 
Instructions: 
o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. 
o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. 
o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. 
o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. 
o Serve chilled. 
 
Nuoc Cham 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1/4 cup fish sauce 
o 1/4 cup lime juice 
o 2 tablespoons sugar

o 2 cloves garlic 
o 1-2 Thai chilies 
o 1/4 cup water 
 
Instructions: 
o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, minced garlic, and sliced chilies in a bowl. 
o Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. 
o Serve as a dipping sauce. 
 
Oi Muchim 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cucumbers 
o 2 cloves garlic 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
o 1 tablespoon gochugaru (Korean chili powder) 
o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds 
 
Instructions: 
o Slice cucumbers thinly. 
o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, gochugaru, and sesame seeds in a bowl. 
o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. 
o Serve chilled. 
 
Onigiri (Rice Balls) 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups cooked sushi rice 
o 1/4 cup filling (salmon, pickled plum) 
o 1 sheet nori (seaweed) 
 
Instructions: 
o Wet hands and shape rice into balls or triangles. 
o Make a small indentation and add filling. 
o Wrap with a strip of nori. 
o Serve immediately. 
 
Pão de Queijo 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups tapioca flour 
o 1 cup milk 
o 1/2 cup butter 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
o 2 eggs 
 
Instructions: 
o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
o Heat milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan until boiling.

o Remove from heat and stir in tapioca flour until smooth. 
o Let cool slightly, then mix in grated cheese and beaten eggs. 
o Form dough into balls and place on a baking sheet. 
o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Pad See Ew 
 
Ingredients: 
o 8 ounces wide rice noodles 
o 1/2 pound chicken breast 
o 1 cup broccoli 
o 2 eggs 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 2 tablespoons oyster sauce 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 
 
Instructions: 
o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. 
o Sauté sliced chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. 
o Scramble eggs in the same pan. 
o Add noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, stir to combine. 
o Add broccoli and cooked chicken, stir-fry until heated through. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Pad Thai 
 
Ingredients: 
o 8 ounces rice noodles 
o 1/2 pound shrimp 
o 2 eggs 
o 1 cup bean sprouts 
o 1/4 cup peanuts 
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce 
o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1 tablespoon lime juice 
o 1/4 cup green onions 
 
Instructions: 
o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. 
o Sauté shrimp in a pan until cooked, then set aside.
